part.Name: Description
part.Short: =pronouns.Subjective= stands sentinel in the salt-blanketed dunes, wrapped in tattered strips. =pronouns.Possessive= weathered form, veiled in crimson patterns, echoes with the wisdom of ages past. Water no longer interests =pronouns.possessiveAdjective=, =pronouns.possessive= moisture long since given to the wind.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Travellers to Qud must steel themselves against many strange sights, this is well-known. But nothing prepared me for watching the shambling figure rise from where poor Tyrabas had fallen. -Shwyshwoshum the Steadfast

part.Name: Description
part.Short: 'Never die in the swamp while carrying cloning draught.' -Old Joppan Proverb
